text: Cece groaned. "See I didn't reject him. He just took it the wrong way and cried. I can't have him cry everytime I talk to him about something and it doesn't go his way." She spoke.
He looks into her eyes “How do you think he feels? Trying to open up to someone and then they reject him because he was upset on the anniversary of the worst day of his life?”
Cece sighed. "Yeah I know. I just. I can't" she spoke softly.
His father looks at her “He’s crying because yesterday was the anniversary of it.” He reminds her
Cece sighed. "He's so emotionally unstable though. I can't deal with him crying all the time. That's like having a newborn." She explained.

He nods “That’s what he flashes back to, that day when those two people broke him entirely. And I had hoped, with the way he talked about you, he might be finally on the mend. But now, now I’m not so sure.”
Cece sighed. "Ugh Harvey." She said and put her face in her hands.
He nods “And guess who was in the car, watching as the two people he loved most killed two thirds of his family?”
Cece looked at him surprised. "Oh my god. That's so cruel." She spoke gently.

“She went after his ex and best friend. Harvey’s ex was the daughter of her best friend. She thought that she could at least find out why they did what they did. Instead, they ran her over and killed her and Harvey’s unborn sister.”
"Not really" she spoke.
He nods “Do you know how?”
"His mother?" She asked looking at him.
“A year ago and a day. Now, do you know who else he lost that night?”
Cece shrugged. "I'd be pissed and depressed. But it was a year ago. I would've gotten over it by now. Everything happens for a reason " she spoke truthfully.

He nods “I thought so. Now let me pose you a question; how would you be if on your birthday, you had your heart broken by your significant other and your best friend, and then have them die before you could try and fix the dynamics between you?”

Cece looked at his father confused. "Well he said he found his best friends dick balls deep in his girlfriends throat in his parents bed and then he said that they both got in a car accident and died soon after" she explained.
“Tell me what he told you about that day”
He looks at her “He didn’t tell you the full story, did he? He told you the version that everyone else knows, the ones who didn’t need to know the truth.”
him then she doesn't deserve his tears" Cece spoke.

Cece sighed. "He had been crying during the day cause I told him it was going to take time for him to get into my heart. And honestly he mentioned his cuts and the memories flooding back and it pissed me off because he was comparing his ex to me without even getting to know me, and instead of getting over something that happened a year ago and going on with his life like a man. He's crying and cutting himself over a girl who isn't worth it. If she could do something that bad to someone like +
“What happened exactly, if you don’t mind me asking?”
Cece nodded. "Yep. He pissed me off to the max" she spoke.
He nods “Let me guess, he had one of his flashbacks to that day, got very emotional and made you mad?”
Cece looked around at the garden. "We got in a fight over his ex"
He frowns “But...” he sighs and looks at her “Why are you out here then?”
Cece looked at him confused. "What do you mean? I work for Harvey as the house diner and dancer now. That's it" she spoke gently.
He watches her “Why aren’t you with Harvey? The way he talks about you, I thought you were together.”
Cece looked at him and her eyes widened. "Oh my gosh." She said and then bowed down to him.
He quietly sits down and looks at her “So you must be Cecilia?” He says softly
Cece was still sitting in the garden, not noticing that anyone was approaching her.
Harvey’s father was walking around. He sees Cece and walks over to her.
((Ummok))
(Imma try something)
Cece loved nature. She admired the breathtaking view of the garden and she calmed down.
The garden was his late mother’s, and had some of his favourite flowers. Harvey looks up his ceiling, on which he had pasted pictures of places he wanted to go in his life.
((Sorry))
Cece roams the halls then finds the garden and sits down.
((Oh okay then. I don't make my characters like me.))
((Yep. All my characters are like me remember?))
Harvey stays in his room, trying to calm down
((Nope. You do?))
Cece looks through her phone and then decides to go walk around the castle to release some steam.
((You do realise I have similar emotional scars to Harvey, so I react like him in certain situations?))
Harvey goes back to his room and sits there
Cece sighed and sat back on her bed still frustrated by him. Now she realized that just because you have money, doesn't mean you'll be happy.
Harvey stares at the door in shock

"There's no point in me being here except for pleasure. So I'll be here for pleasure. Whenever you want me I'm here. You're too emotionally unstable for me to be anything but." She spoke softly then closed the door.
Harvey looks at her when he’s finished
Cece listened as she looked at him.
“I’m sorry I’m socially inept and don’t know what to do. I’m sorry that I still get hurt by reminders of my ex. I’m sorry that the only way I know how to make friends is by buying them.”
Cece looked at him expectantly.
“I’m sorry” he says softly
Cece came to her door and opened it with her arms crossed.
“I want to apologise
Cece sat on her bed frustrated. "What?!" She replied
Harvey knocks on her door
Cece goes to her room closing the door behind her.
Harvey sighs and goes after her

"If something happens reflect on it and keep pushing forward. Don't go back to square one. Look I don't need to be here if all you're going to do is cry because I remind you of someone who hurt you" she said storming back to her room.
Harvey looks at her “I’m trying to. But as soon as I get close, something happens and I’m back to square one.”

Cece looked at him. "They're only poisoned if you allow those memories to consume you. You're stronger than that Harvey. It's been a whole year since the incident. You need to move on." She spoke softly.
Harvey looks up "She evidently still is able to hurt me. She can hurt me through memories. So many of the things I loved to do have been poisoned by the memory of her."
Cece looked at him. "Yeah but you're not allowed to cry over a girl who's no longer going to be able to hurt you" she spoke softly.
Harvey looks at her "I'm assuming nothing. I'm scared of opening my heart to you because of my past. I'm allowed to be afraid, right?"
Cece looked at him. "You think of me that way huh? You don't even know me and you're gonna assume things that cruel." She said backing up from him.
Harvey looks at her "I don't know. But I'm scared you might."
Cece looked at him. "You really think I would do that to you huh?" She said looking at him hurt by him even comparing the two.
"What you said to me, someone else once said to me. And what they did afterwards broke me." He pulls up his sleeves to show the scars
Cece looked at him worried. "Why?" She asked.
Harvey looks up at her sadly "Because of old memories"
Cece looked at him confused. She studied his face and came in front of him. "Why have you been crying?" She asked.
"Not good" Harvey says quietly, his eyes fixed to the floor
Cece walked in looking beautiful in a casual dress and wedges with her hair half up half down. "Hey, how'd your day go?" She asked softly as she came to him.
"It's open" he says softly
Cece heads to his room and knocks in the door.
Harvey stays in his room
She gets out and gets dressed
Harvey hears but leaves her alone, not wanting to piss her off even more
Cece continued to sing in the shower.
Harvey finishes his meetings and goes to his room
Cece washes herself and sings in the shower.
Harvey closes his eyes and takes deep breaths
Cece soon woke up and went to her room to shower.
Harvey looks at his arms, trying to not relapse again
Cece continued to sleep, not knowing why his bed was so comfortable.
Harvey cries in between the meetings, old feelings being brought up
Cece turns on the tv to something boring and eventually falls asleep
Harvey goes and does his meetings, trying to hide the pain inside
Cece sighed and laid there knowing she wouldn't be able to go to sleep as she closed her eyes.
Harvey sighs “I’m sorry. Sleep well.” He gets up to hide his tears

Cece sighed. "Harvey. I know you might be used to this but you can't really buy your way into my heart. Reminder. I still just met you yesterday. I don't know anything about you. I can't be your closest friend in under a day, it's impossible. Things like these take time." She reminded him as she looked up at him.

Harvey frowns “I want you to spend time with me because you want to, not because I’m paying you too. I don’t want you to see it as me paying you off to spend time with me; I want it to be more than that. I want it to be me giving you gifts and you to be my closest friend and more.”
Cece looked at him still confused. "Well you're paying me to spend time with you so I'm going to spend time with you anyway" she reminded him.
Harvey looks at her “Because I feel like I have to convince you I’m worth spending your time with.”
Cece looked at him confused. "How come? I thought you said I was only here to spend time with you when you were free?" She asked as she stayed lying down and looked up at him.
Harvey shakes his head “I cancelled my duties for today to spend the day with you”
Cece sighed. "But I have insomnia Harvey. Who knows when I'll get some sleep? And aren't you busy with ya know, imperial stuff" she asked confused as she laid down and cuddled to his bed.
Harvey looks at her “I’m making sure you get some sleep before we do what I’ve planned today.”
Cece looked at him confused. "What ya doing?" She asked gently as she watched him and looked around.
Harvey wraps his arms around her “Breakfast can wait” he carries her to his bed
Cece sighed and leaned against him, bags under her eyes. She was tired but her body was wide awake.
Harvey looks at her concerned
Cece shrugged. "I just couldn't fall asleep" she said gently as she looks at him
Harvey frowns “What was wrong?” He asks sadly
Cece sighed and took his hand. "I didn't get any sleep last night" she spoke gently as she looked at him.
He holds out his hand to her
Cece nods and yawns.
Harvey looks at her softly “Please join me for breakfast”
Cece opens the door looking at it.
Harvey goes to her room and knocks on her door
Cece looks in the mirror and sees her intense bags under her eyes. She still felt wide awake:
Harvey gets up and stretches
Cece stays up and went she sees the sun up, she gasps.
Harvey doesn’t wake up until morning
Cece stats awake all night watching tv, her body not allowing her to go to sleep.
Harvey takes some pills and passes out asleep
Cece just watched the tv.
Harvey tosses and turns
Cece tried turning on the tv but couldn't sleep still
Harvey climbs into his bed but he too was unable to sleep
Cece looked back at him then left his room and went to hers. She tried to sleep once getting in the bed, yet she was wide awake.
He looks down sadly
Harvey sighs “Good night”
Cece sighed and got up. "I'm gonna go to bed" she said softly.
“I want to though” Harvey says softly
Cece looked at him. "You don't even know me man"
Harvey looks at her “I don’t care about social class, I care about you”
Cece sighed. "I belong in my class. I'm low class Harvey" she spoke.
Harvey looks back at her “It was they who didn’t belong, not you”
Cece loooked up at him worried. "You saw what happened tonight" she spoke softly.
“Yes you do” he replies gently
"I don't belong here" she spoke softly.
“Anything and everything” Harvey says softly
"Talk to you about what?" She asked gently as she put the cake plate down.
Harvey looks at her sadly “Talk to me. Please.”
Cece looked at him and shook her head, nothing being wrong as she finished the cake.
Harvey looks at her softly “What’s wrong?”
Cece kept eating not wanting to remember what they did tonight.
Harvey sits beside her “It was those bitches’ fault. To think I was in love with someone like them...”
Cece looked toward him and sighed and just kept eating.
Harvey shakes his head “I didn’t even want the party”
"Because you didn't enjoy your party, and it's all my fault" she spoke.
Harvey frowns “Why are you sorry?”
Cece looked at him. "I'm sorry" she spoke softly and continued eating.
Harvey pulls on his bottoms and walks over to her
Cece looked down as she continued to eat.
Harvey sighs “It was okay I guess” he says quietly
Cece continued to eat. "How was the rest of the party?" She asked softly.
He smiles and closes the door, quietly getting ready for bed behind her
She sat up slowly and pulled the cake to her lap and held the fork in her hand starting to eat.
“Eat” Harvey says softly “Please”
Cece looked at the cake then back at him starving
Harvey sets the slice of cake in front of her
Cece looks into his eyes cutely as she stayed cuddling.
Harvey crouches in front of her
Cece watched him still cuddled into the couch and sniffling
Harvey quietly walks over to her
Cece snuggled and looked at him with her tear stained face.
Harvey sighs sadly and goes to his room, wanting to lie down and relax. He walks into his room and freezes when he sees her.
Cece couldn't hear since she was laying on the couch in his room as she wiped her eyes.
Harvey walks to her room to bring her her cake. He knocks on the door gently “Hey, I’ve brought you some cake if you would like it.” He says softly
Cece laid on the couch in his room, winding down as she cried silently about what happened.
Harvey thanks his guests for coming as the party winds down. He sighs and gets Cece a piece of cake.
Cece sighed and after showering she went to his room after getting dressed. She felt her stomach growl and sighed.
Harvey goes back to the party in a glum mood
Cece got up and went to shower, disgusted by all the spit on her.
Harvey carries her to her room and lays her on the bed. “Sleep. I’ll leave you be until the morning.” He says softly, gently kissing her forehead and leaves the room
Cece just kept her face into his chest. She knew she needed the job but she didn't know if she could deal with all the gold diggers hating on her.
Harvey helps her up and carries her away from the people “Please. Give me a chance to show how amazing this place can be.”
Cece looked up at him, her eyes watering. "Look at me. I don't belong here" she spoke softly.
Harvey shakes his head “Please don’t say that”
Cece stayed looking down as the reporters continued to take pictures of her and she shook her head. "This was a bad idea" she spoke softly looking down to hide her face. Disgusted by herself.
Harvey gets the guards to escort the girls away, then bends down to help Cece “I’m so sorry” He says soflty

The girls looked at him annoyed then walked past her and attacked her as they were heading out all of them spit onto her and ripped her dress up before leaving. Cece was on the floor covered in spit and her dress was torn completely up now. She just continued to look down at the ground, tears in her eyes.

“Actually, your dance did nothing for me whatsoever.” He looks at the girls “While hers made me happy. But I’d prefer a lower class classy girl, then a jumped up upper class slut.” Harvey says firmly “Now I will ask you one more time, leave, or I will have you escorted from the premises forcefully.”

They laughed. "That's cause we are better than her. She's literally in the lowest class there is. She's low class trash. Plus that stupid ass dance was so immature. He's 21 not 14. He's a man now. Give the man what he wants like we did" they said talking to him then to her. || Cece just stayed looking down, staring at her bracelet as everyone was now watching.
Harvey shakes his head “For the very selfsame reason you just said; you think you’re better than her.”
"We're just trying to figure out why if you could have this, you'd pick that." They spoke gently. || Cece sighed refusing to look up, embarrassed as people watched.
He glares at the offending girl in pure anger
“Get out” Harvey orders “How dare you insult a personal guest of mine?”
"Is she a charity case? If so, we totally get it" another one of them spoke. || Cece looked down knowing she didn't belong here in this class.
Harvey glares at the girl “That is between me and the lady”
Cece watches as they would send her glares everytime they glanced at her and one of them asked about what's the deal between him and her.
Harvey politely thanks the girls but only polls above their neck, not at their scantily clad bodies
She returned a soft smile back and noticed the pole dancer performers come over with their presents for him.
Harvey smiles softly and looks at her
Cece clapped along with everyone else as they put the cake back in the cake table and started serving it
*silently
Harvey blows out the candles, slightly making a wish
Cece was startled a little by his gesture, yet looked up at him and watched as the cake was brought to him so he could blow out the candles
Harvey leans across and gently holds her hand under the table “It’s going to be okay”
Cece looked completely out of her element, and not at ease whatsoever. She wasn't used to the attention as she looked down and played with her bracelet nervous.
Harvey doesn’t look at the cake; only at her
Cece looked around then saw then start wheeling out a huge cake toward him, as she tried to ignore all the people taking photos of them together.
Harvey nods “Okay”
Cece nodded embarrassed:
Harvey shakes his head “You?”
Cece looked around at everyone as she played with her bracelet on her wrist. "Are you a virgin?" She asked curiously.
Harvey chuckles “I’ll take that as a yes then”
Cece blushed hard. "It was unexpected for sure" she said gently not wanting to fall for him.
Harvey blushes slightly “Did you enjoy it?”
Cece nodded. "So yeah I have no idea what I'm doing. The kiss we had in the hallway was my first" she spoke gently.
Harvey raises an eyebrow "Really?"
Cece bit her lip. "Well fun fact about me. I've never had a boyfriend before" she spoke softly
Harvey nods "Yep"
Cece blushed. "Oh really?"
*ever been
"None" he answers honestly "My ex is the only girl I've been been with"
Cece nodded. "So how many of these girls have you fucked?" She asked.
Harvey sips on his drink "I guess you must have some more questions?"
Cece giggled and nodded looking around
Harvey chuckles "Better?" He looks at her
Cece blushed as everyone started going back to their own business and having fun.
Harvey smiles back and looks at everyone "Isn't this supposed to be a party?"
Cece sat down beside him and glanced over at him smiling slightly.
Harvey untucks a chair for her and sits in his
Cece heard gasps and whispered as they headed to the table.
Harvey looks at her and smiles reassuringly as he leads her to his table
Cece walked in with him, nervous about all the girl's eyeing her with their eyes full of hatred.
Harvey leads her back to the party
Cece blushed hard and nodded speechless.
Harvey chuckles and puts his arm around her waist "Ready to party?"
Cece knew they had to stop before someone caught them, so she pulled away from the kiss, biting her bottom lip and looking into her car.
Harvey deepens the kiss, his hands resting on her hips, the taste of her on his lips intoxicating

Cece gasped surprised when he leaned in and kissed her. She thought of what they had just spoke about then got distracted by how good of a kisser he was and she couldn't help but kiss back. She rested her hands on his chest gently.
Harvey steps forward and kisses her softly, wrapping his arms around her
Cece blushed hard. "Oh thanks. You ready?" She asked softly and nodded, as she looked into his eyes.
Harvey sees her and his eyes widen "Damn you look amazing '
Cece made sure she looked okay, then came out, feeling like she had transformed into a princess of some sort.
Harvey waits, taking deep breaths as he looks around
Cece got dressed in a fancy dress that costs more than her whole apartment, as well as heels and she took her hair down from it's French braid, revealing beach waves.
Harvey waits outside for her, trying to repress the memories. She was the complete opposite of his ex, yet she made him feel the same mixture of love, care and lust.

Cece giggled hearing him say obvious reasons. "Um, well I'll go get dressed." She said softly and pulled a strand of hair behind her ear as she walked in and closed the door picking out the perfect dress, based on what she saw the other girls wearing.
Harvey nods "Follow me" he takes her to the room next to his "Take wherever you want from here. This is to be your room as well. Close to mine for obvious reasons."

Cece shivered at the thought. "That's very promiscuous if you ask me." She spoke softly then remembered she was still in her costume. "Do you have a sister, or someone I could borrow a dress from?" She asked knowing it wasn't in dress code for her to wear her lower class clothes.
Harvey nods "She was amazing, till I found her naked in my parents's bed, with my best friend's dick balls deep down her throat." He looks at her and sighs "Fine" he stands up and looks at her

Cece listened to him. "So you did have a girlfriend..." she spoke softly. "Well would you enjoy the party if I stayed by your side during it. I mean all these people came to celebrate you turning 21, it would be a bummer if you disappeared and never reappeared for the rest of the party." She spoke gently.

Harvey looks at her "I don't care for parties. I haven't for as long as I haven't felt the feelings you have brought back up in me." He says softly "Not since she cheated on me with my best friend at my party last year before dying with him in a car crash."
Cece looked at him confused. "What do you mean? It's your birthday party. They haven't even cut your cake yet." She asked giggling slightly at his haste as she looked at him.
Harvey looks at her "If you start immediately, neither of us are going back to that party" he tells her honestly "We're both spending the night here."

Cece nodded. "I would start immediately but your party is going on, and I only brought my costume and the clothes I came in aren't fancy enough for this party at all." She spoke as she walked around glancing at many of the items around his room.
Harvey looks at her "Immediately if you wish. Or you can start within a week." He says softly, not wanting to push her into it
Cece shook her head. "Okay, when do I start?" she spoke knowing she needed the money. She had been in a relationship in awhile so she didn't know how well she was going to do.
((a measurement someone else has 😳))
"Five and a half inches, ish" Harvey says quietly
Cece raised an eyebrow not knowing if she believed it or not. "Second, I'm only going to do this if I know how big it is" she said and looked down at his pants then back at him.
Harvey looks at her "Because when you walked into that room, I felt things I haven't felt in a long while."
Cece smirked only slightly. "Why me? Out of all of those girls at the party, all of them want you, and you go for a lower class girl? Why?" She asked gently.
Harvey looks at her and smiles "Name your conditions"
Cece' eyes widened when she heard. "Oh wow um. Yeah I will as long as you do some things for me first" she mentioned thinking about something.

Harvey looks at her "I do not have a significant other." He says gently "That was just the clearest way I could think of it." He looks at her "Let me put it like this; in exchange for helping you with your career as a singer and dancer, I would like to date you and spend my free time with you."

Cece looks at him and tilts her head. "Wait, doesn't it require you to have a significant other, for me to be a mistress, and are you saying you want me here whenever you need to relieve yourself?" She said catching on.
, being up front with her
Harvey looks down "With the private performances, it wouldn't be singing and dancing as much as being my mistress." He says softly

Cece nodded. "So you want me to come live here? And be a house performer? I don't get the whole personal performer thing though. Why would you need me to come sing and dance for only you?" She asked as she stood up.
Harvey nods "Don't worry. You'll be given a room and paid handsomely for your work."
Cece looked at him confused. "I'm wouldn't that require me to be here like a lot?" She asked knowing she already worked another job and wouldn't be able to drive back and forth everyday.
Harvey nods "You'll be my house singer and dancer, along with some more personal performances if and when I require."
Cece tilted her head curiously. "Personal entertainer?" She asked gently, waiting on him to reiterate.
Harvey shakes his head "You won't be a maid, more my personal entertainer" he says softly, trying to word it in a way that wasn't too forward or crude.

Cece looked at him. "Work? Like a maid? I can only dance and sing, I'm not really good for anything else" she spoke gently as she noticed him look into her eyes. She felt butterflies in her stomach as she looked away.
Harvey looks into her eyes "How would you like to work for me? You'll be paid highly, have access to the best coaches and staff available and you'll be treated like a princess."
Cece smiled a little more. "Um yeah thank you." She spoke as she stayed, sitting on his bed in her costume, not having gotten the chance to change first.
Harvey smiles and blushes and before looking at her "You're a brilliant singer, a great dancer and are very beautiful."
Cece smiled softly, "oh thank you. Happy birthday by the way" she spoke gently and nodded.
((Like I would ask her out, date her then try and sleep with her if we connected. But this dude is going to go from 0 to 100 real fast.)
Harvey looks at her "First off, you were amazing out there." He gushed to put her at ease
Since his bed was the closest, she just sat by the edge still a little confused.
((I'm so glad my discomfort is funny to you 😜😘))
"Take your pick. You can sit anywhere you would like to." Harvey says softly to reassure her, still going over his words in his head

Cece looked at how his room was so big and he had a couch and a tv as well as his desk and his bed. "Um, where..?" She asked gently looking at all the possibly seating options. ((😂yeah this is going to be so fun))
((This is going to be fun for me to word. You know what Harvey is about to do goes against my nature. 😂))
Harvey sees her nervousness "I'm not going to hurt you, I promise. Please, take a seat."
Cece raised an eyebrow. "Oh okay, your highness." She spoke and stepped in closing the door behind her, confused and nervous to the max.
Harvey shakes his head "I asked one of the servants to put the note on your door. I wanted to speak with you in private, just us two."

Cece soon go to the door and knocked a bit before coming in. Once she saw him, she gasped nervously and tried to speak. "Oh um oh my. I'm sorry I got this note, and it told me to come here. It must've been a mistake..?" She said in her gentle speaking voice as she looked around at his huge room.
Harvey was sitting in his room, trying to work out what he would say to her if and when she came

Cece walked into her dressing room and noticed the note. She read it and thought it was just his advisors wanting to thank them for performing tonight, not thinking much else of it. She left her stuff in the dressing room expecting that she would be back, and headed to where it said to go, not knowing it was his room.
Harvey stays at the party for a few minutes before sneaking away to his room, expecting her to be there
Cece soon finishes the song and the routine and as everyone cheers they all wave and bow to let's say prince Harvey before heading back to backstage and into their dressing rooms.
Harvey gets one of the servants to leave a message on her dressing room, telling her how to get to his room
Cece giggled and kept dancing until it was almost her queue so she kissed his cheek as a birthday gift and headed back up to the stage and continued the routine.
Harvey blushes slightly and tries to dance, his eyes fixed to her
Cece eventually danced with the crowd and then comes over to the birthday boy and grabs his hand pulling him up to dance with her as she danced and sang.
Harvey glares at the people dancing with her jealously, wanting her for himself
Cece giggled and kept singing and dancing as she starts heading down the stage and dancing through and with the crowd.
Harvey keeps watching, sipping his drink as she danced and sung. He ignored everyone else but her. He shifts slightly when he feels a tightening in his trousers.
Cece continue to dance, being the center of the routine since she was the lead singer. Sooner or later, people start dancing to her singing as she starts to have fun with it, her nerves calming.
Harvey keeps his eyes fixed to Cecelia, watching her sing and dance
Soon the lights started changing color as the music played and she started singing birthday by Selena Gomez and they started doing their dance routine.
Harvey's eyes almost pop out of his head when he sees her. She was beautiful. He watches her intently.
As she came onto stage and the spotlight appeared on her, small and dim spotlights on the backup dancers, she soon starts singing.

Harvey was bored by the jugglers and sword eater, having seen similar many times before. The pole dancers were good, but too whorish and eager to try and give him a lap dance. He sighs and waits for the last act.

As the three performers before her went on, Cece sipped her water and made sure to not ruin her costume as she wore it. Soon it was her turn to perform and the advisor announced only that a singing selection was coming up next, as the lights went dark and she came on stage with her headpiece mic in along with backup dancers and they got in their spots.
Harvey was told the performances would start, and he turns his head to look at the stage

Cece got dressed in her outfit and tried to ball up her nerves as the advisor had announced that they would start performances. They put hers last sense they thought he would like hers most, as the first act went on.

Harvey sips his drink looking around, noting how many of the girls here had tried to seduce him. The only girl he had ever been with though had died last year, and he hadn't ever been with anyone since.

(Damn, your responses always make mine look weak)

Soon after the guests eating, she and a few others would preform for him for his 21st birthday. Where everything is legal. When men become their own man and such. She had heard that he was easy on the eyes as well and many girls in his class were after him, whether it was for the money or his looks or both. She didn't get how girls could fall in love with someone they've never even met though. She wasn't one to let people in easily, let alone fall in love.

Cecelia, known as cece by her friends, was getting dressed to perform for the son of an important imperial family, and the next in line for the family name. Everyone who was anyone would be at his party and luckily Cece got personally invited to perform for him after one of his advisors noticed her solo at one of her recitals. She was no where close to being in the class that the people as this party were in, and to perform for them was an honor to her, yet it was highly nerve wrecking as well.+
Harvey was sitting in his seat of honour, eating heartily and looking around at all the people present
